equation

Class NumberParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • equation.NumberParser

  • public final class NumberParser
extends java.lang.Object
    The NumberParser class's purpose is to merge numbers and decimal points within a String, and aggregate mathematical symbols and numbers into a list of AggregateType. This is the first step in converting a String into a mathematical statement. The AggregateType is used to assign a aggregated String a subclass of Symbol. This class does not require resource
    Since:
    9/22/2019
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Alejandro Doberenz

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  NumberParser.AggregateType
      The AggregateType is a rough categorization of the different type of characters the parser may encounter.

    • Method Detail

      • determineAggregateType

        public static NumberParser.AggregateType determineAggregateType(java.lang.Object obj)
        Attempts to assign a given object an AggregateType. It will throw an IllegalArgumentException in the event one cannot be found.
        Parameters:
        obj - An object you want to assign an AggregateType
        Returns:
        The AggregateType of the passed object

      • determineAggregateTypeArray

        public static java.util.ArrayList<NumberParser.AggregateType> determineAggregateTypeArray(char[] characters)
        Preforms the determineAggregateType(Object) method on an array of chars. A char array was used because the determineAggregateType(Object) method converts Strings to chars.
        Parameters:
        characters - An array that will be passed one by one to the determineAggregateType(Object) method
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of the passed array's AggregateType

      • aggregateNumbers

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aggregateNumbers(java.lang.String statement)
        Cuts a String into separate Strings that contain only a single mathematical symbol, or a number.
        Parameters:
        statement - A String that contains a mathematical statement
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Strings
